Header: American non-profit helps teach kids to eat healthy through learning gardens
Content: Childhood obesity is a major problem in the U.S. as well as other parts of the world, 18 percent of Americans aged between two and 19 are currently obese. Kimbal Musk, the younger brother of billionaire businessman Elon Musk, runs Big Green, a non-profit that builds gardens in low-income schools across America. It has installed 500 of them in six U.S. cities over the past six years. Big Green comes up with ways to tie the outdoor learning garden into the schoolâ€™s curriculum so that the students are using the garden all the time as an outdoor classroom. Welby Community School is one of the participating schools. As Brynn Olinger, a Big Green Colorado Garden Educator who has been working at Welby introduced, the students have had a lot of fun spending time in the garden.
